text: The medial inguinal fossa is a depression located within the inguinal triangle on the peritoneal surface of the anterior abdominal wall between the ridges formed by the lateral umbilical fold and the medial umbilical ligament, corresponding to the superficial inguinal ring. ==Clinical significance== It is associated with direct inguinal hernias. ==See also== * Lateral inguinal fossa ==External links== * - "Internal surface of the anterior abdominal wall." Category:Abdomen
title: Medial inguinal fossa
